ai.summary: A roughly 7.7 km circular hike around the Erewash area, combining canal towpaths, rural lanes and light woodland. Moderate difficulty with gentle gradients and some uneven ground.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses a mix of surfaces: paved paths, compacted gravel, grassy verges, and muddy sections after rain. Expect gates and occasional stiles, short woodland stretches, and open field sections with variable footing.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and appropriate clothing for variable UK weather. Parts of the route run along canal towpaths and rural lanes where edges can be narrow and uneven; stay alert for cyclists and other pedestrians. Ground can be wet and muddy after rain; use caution on uneven or slippery sections and watch for gates and steps. Carry a map or charged phone, enough water, and a small first-aid kit. Check current closures or restrictions before you set out.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots or shoes with good grip
Map or GPS device and a charged phone
Sunscreen and hat in sunny months
Lightweight headtorch if you might be out near dusk
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer the best conditions, but the route can be enjoyed year-round with suitable clothing and planning.

seo.title: Erewash Circular Walk 20 – 7.7 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan a 7.7 km circular hike on Erewash Circular Walk 20. A moderate route through UK countryside featuring canal towpaths, rural lanes and light woodland.
